terms.intro: Welcome to "hebbirthday" (the "Application" or "Service"). Use of the Application, its services, and its content is subject to the terms detailed below ("Terms of Use"). section1.title: 1. Definition of the Service
section1.content: The Application provides a platform for managing, centralizing, and tracking birthdays. The Service allows users to create closed "Organizations" (Tenants), input birthday details (including Gregorian date, Hebrew date, gender, and "after sunset" status), and manage records in a collaborative environment based on permissions (Owner, Admin, Member). The Application includes automatic calculation of Hebrew dates and an option to sync with the user's personal Google Calendar.

You are solely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login details and for all activity that occurs under your account. Each user is associated with one or more "Organizations" (Tenants) and operates according to the permissions defined for them in that organization.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy for "hebbirthday"
privacy.intro: We respect the privacy of our users ("you", "the user") and are committed to protecting it. This Privacy Policy describes what personal information we collect, how we use it, with whom we share it, and your rights regarding this information.

section1.title: 1. What Information Do We Collect?
section1.intro: We collect the following types of information:

item1.title: Account Details:
item1.content: Display name, email address, phone number (optional), and photo URL (optional). If you register via a third-party service (like Google), we collect the information passed to us from that service.

item2.title: Password:
item2.content: If you register with an email, your password is stored in an encrypted format.

section1.item3: Information about third parties (the birthday subjects): First name, last name, Gregorian birth date, gender (optional), and whether the birth was "after sunset".
section1.item5: Notes or Wishlist items you add to records.
section1.item6: Technical identifiers (such as IP address) collected by our infrastructure services (Firebase) for operational, security, and usage analysis purposes.

section2.title: 2. How Do We Use the Information?
section2.intro: The use of information is solely for the following purposes:
section2.item1: To enable the proper functioning of the Application, provide you with the Service, and authenticate your identity.
section2.item2: To display birthday details to members of your Organization (Tenant).
section2.item3: To perform calculations of Hebrew dates (as detailed in Section 3).
section2.item4: To allow you to sync events to your personal Google Calendar (as detailed in Section 3).

section3.title: 3. Sharing Information with Third Parties
section3.intro: We do not sell or share your personal information, except in cases essential for the operation of the Service:
section3.content1: User-generated content you enter (such as birthday details) will be visible to other users in the same "Organization" (Tenant) to which the record belongs, according to the project's security settings.
section3.content2: The Application is built on Google's Firebase platform, which is used for authentication, data storage (Firestore), and code execution (Functions). Your information is stored on Google's servers and is subject to their privacy policy.
section3.content3: For the purpose of accurate Hebrew date calculation, we automatically send the Gregorian date, gender (if provided), and "after sunset" status to the external Hebcal API. We do not send names or any other personally identifiable information (like first or last name) to this service.
section3.subtitle4: Google Calendar API (With Your Consent Only):
section3.item1: If you choose to sync your birthdays, the Application will request your permission to access your Google Calendar (scope: calendar.events).
section3.item2: We will use this permission solely to create, update, and delete birthday events that the Application created for you.
section3.item3: To enable these actions, we store an accessToken for your account in our database (googleCalendarTokens). This token is stored securely, is accessible only to you, and is not used for any other purpose, especially not for reading existing events in your calendar that were not created by the Application.

section4.title: 4. International Data Transfer
section4.content: The use of Firebase and Hebcal services involves your information potentially being stored and processed on servers located outside the borders of the State of Israel. We rely on these providers to employ security measures that meet international standards.

section5.title: 5. Data Retention and Backup Policy
section5.content: We retain personal information only for the time necessary for the purposes for which it was collected. Personal information for your account and the birthday data you entered are retained in the active system as long as your account is active and the data has not been deleted by you or an administrator in your organization. We may maintain backups of the database for a limited period for disaster recovery purposes. Information deleted from the active system may remain in these backups until their final deletion.

section6.title: 6. Children's Privacy
section6.content: The service is not intended for use by children under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under this age.

section7.title: 7. User Rights
section7.content: Under the Privacy Protection Law, you are entitled to review your personal information, request its correction, or request its deletion. To exercise these rights, or for any other privacy-related questions, please contact us via email at:

section8.title: 8. Changes to the Privacy Policy
section8.content: We reserve the right to update this policy from time to time.
